title: [BUG Fix] Deadlock issue of InputIterator
chore: a construct method for default change builder
body:
> [!NOTE]
> The simpler it is, the easier it is to make mistakes.

### Description

I made a mistake in #108. :persevere:

Even `DefaultChangeBuilder` is public, but all its fields are private, users couldn't construct it, outside the `ckb-sdk`.

This time, I tested in my local machine before submit this PR.

title: chore: change visibility of default change builder to be public
body: Please make them to be public, so I don't have to copy them to my repository.

title: fix: override the original witnesses when sign transactions
body:
### Issue

I'm working on a new type script, which requires its own witness.

But when I build a transaction with `ckb_sdk::XxxUnlocker`, the witness will be overridden.

- When sign transactions, the method to handle witnesses are correct.

  https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb-sdk-rust/blob/c45c4dc0c92bb1f983e878e3ef1876b861ca7038/src/unlock/signer.rs#L109-L119

- But, when call the following code to prepare for sign transactions:

  https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb-sdk-rust/blob/c45c4dc0c92bb1f983e878e3ef1876b861ca7038/src/transaction/builder/mod.rs#L182

  The original witnesses will be overridden.

I tested this patch with my project, it works!

title: sudt's amount type should be `u128`
body:
In https://github.com/nervosnetwork/rfcs/blob/master/rfcs/0025-simple-udt/0025-simple-udt.md#sudt-cell
```
data:
    amount: uint128
type:
    code_hash: simple_udt type script
    args: owner lock script hash (...)
lock:
    <user_defined>
```
sudt's amount type should be u128. Fix #105

title: Support more RPC for ckb and ckb-light-client
body:
This PR want to close #94 and https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb-sdk-rust/issues/97 

- [x] CKB
  - [x] calculate_dao_field
  - [x] calculate_dao_maximum_withdraw
  - [x] ~~dry_run_transaction (deprecated)~~
  - [x] generate_block currently does not support passing a warehouse
  - [x] generate_block_with_template
  - [x] get_block_filter
  - [x] get_fee_rate_statics(&self, tartet: Option) -> FeeRateStatistics
	- [x] Typo in "tartet"
  - [x] FeeRateStatistics should be an Option
    - [x] get_fee_rate_statistics, same as get_fee_rate_statics
    - [x] get_transaction does not support the "only_committed" parameter

- [x] CKB Light Client
  - [x] fetch_transaction: it should be TransactionWithStatus, not TransactionWithHeader.
  - [x] get_transaction: it should be TransactionWithStatus, not TransactionWithHeader.
  - [x] set_script: not support SetScriptCommand
  - [x] local_node_info: not support now

title: chore: refactor SimpleTransactionBuilder
body: This PR refactors `SimpleTransactionBuilder` to simplify the process of building transactions by introducing the `estimate_tx_size` parameter, which makes building transactions simpler and more flexible. the `SmallChangeAction` struct in the original code is an edge case in real-world scenarios for sdk, and is only used when the user needs to transfer all ckb capacity from one address to another address. putting the processing logic of this edge scenario into `SimpleTransactionBuilder` introduces unnecessary complexity, and if needed, we can introduce another builder to specifically handle this requirement via PR later.

docs: Improve README.md
body:
:heart: , Thanks for @EthanYuan 's work. 

What problem does this PR solve?

This PR simply updates the existing README file for the CKB SDK Rust. The main additions include sections on Installation, Building, and Quick Start.

The changes do not affect the functionality of the SDK itself, but rather aim to make the documentation clearer and more readable for developers.
